Job Description:
Croem Inc is seeking a talented Software Engineer to join our innovative team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software development, specifically with experience in the .NET framework. You will work collaboratively in an agile environment, contributing to the design, implementation, and maintenance of software applications. As a Software Engineer, you will engage with cross-functional teams to identify requirements and create solutions that meet customer needs. This role is essential in ensuring the performance and reliability of our software products while adhering to best coding practices and standards. You will not be required to manage a team, allowing you to focus solely on your technical contributions and growth within the organization.
Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain software applications using the .NET framework.
Collaborate with product management and design teams to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
Write clean, scalable, and efficient code that adheres to industry standards.
Conduct code reviews to ensure quality and share knowledge with peers.
Debug and troubleshoot software issues, identifying root causes and implementing solutions promptly.
Participate in agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives.
Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends to continuously enhance skills and apply new ideas to projects.
Contribute to the development of technical documentation, including architecture diagrams and user guides.
Assist in the deployment of applications and monitor performance in production environments.
Collaborate with QA teams to design and execute test plans, ensuring high-quality software delivery.

St. Michael LLC is seeking a skilled Software Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software development and experience with programming languages such as Java, C++, and JavaScript. This role is crucial in building and maintaining software solutions that meet the needs of our clients. In this position, the Software Engineer will work closely with project managers and other stakeholders to enhance the overall functionality and user experience of applications. The role does not require team management duties but emphasizes collaboration within a team environment to achieve common project goals.
Responsibilities
Design, develop, and implement high-quality software solutions using Java, C++, and JavaScript.
Collaborate with product managers and other engineers to understand project requirements and translate them into technical specifications.

Learn and adapt to new technologies and programming languages as required for project needs.
Perform thorough testing of developed applications to ensure they meet the highest standards of functionality and usability.
Contribute to team meetings and brainstorming sessions to share ideas and feedback on improving software solutions.

Wayne Enterprises is seeking a skilled Software Engineer to join our innovative team. In this dynamic role, you will contribute to designing, developing, and maintaining software applications that enhance the operational capabilities of our organization. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to create robust, scalable, and efficient software solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong proficiency in JavaScript and be ready to engage with cutting-edge technologies to drive project success. As a team leader, you will oversee a team of three talented engineers, providing mentorship and guidance to ensure optimal performance and collaboration within the group. Your leadership will be essential in fostering a positive development environment and driving continuous improvement within the team. We welcome individuals who are passionate about technology and eager to contribute to projects that make a difference. We provide a supportive culture that encourages professional development, and we are excited to find a candidate who aligns with our mission to innovate and excel in the field of software engineering.
Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain high-quality software applications using JavaScript and other programming languages.
Lead, mentor, and manage a team of three software engineers, ensuring project goals are met and team dynamics remain strong.
Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
Conduct code reviews to maintain code quality, ensure adherence to best practices, and facilitate knowledge sharing among team members.
Implement software development methodologies such as Agile and Scrum to optimize team performance and ensure timely delivery of projects.
Identify and resolve software defects and performance issues, ensuring improved user experience and system reliability.
Stay current with industry trends, technologies, and best practices in software engineering to drive continual learning and innovation within the team.
Participate in architecture discussions and contribute to the long-term technical vision of the organization.
Prepare and maintain project documentation, including design specifications, user manuals, and operational guides.
Facilitate regular team meetings to discuss progress, challenges, and upcoming tasks, ensuring clarity in roles and accountability.

They must have strong, firsthand technical expertise in a variety of configuration management and big data technologies and the proven ability to fashion robust scalable solutions that can manage large data sets. They must be at ease working in an agile environment with little supervision. This person should embody a passion for continuous improvement and test-driven development.

Hands-on experience working with technologies like Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Oozie, Map Reduce, Spark, Sqoop, Kafka, Flume, etc.
Strong DevOps focus and experience building and deploying infrastructure with cloud deployment technologies like Ansible, Chef, puppet, etc.
Experience with test-driven development and automated testing frameworks.
Experience with Scrum/Agile development methodologies.
Capable of delivering on multiple competing priorities with little supervision.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or equivalent experience.
Responsibilities

Design and develop a processing platform using various configuration management technologies.
Test software development methodology in an agile environment.
Provide ongoing maintenance, support and enhancements in existing systems and platforms.
Collaborate cross-functionally with data scientists, business users, project managers, and other engineers to achieve elegant solutions.
Provide recommendations for continuous improvement.
Work alongside other engineers on the team to elevate technology and consistently apply best practices.

Communication and organization skills are keys for this position, along with a problem-solution attitude. Ultimately, you should be able to ensure our database systems run effectively and securely on a daily basis.
Compensation is based on skills and experience.
Only qualified candidates with relevant skills and experience will be considered. Candidate will need to pass a technical test to qualify for this position.

Modisoft is seeking a dedicated Software Quality Assurance Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have at least two years of experience in software testing methodologies, encompassing both manual and automated testing approaches. This role is critical for ensuring that our software products meet the highest standards of quality and performance. The selected individual will be responsible for developing comprehensive test plans and test cases, along with performing rigorous testing of backend services such as APIs and distributed systems. The candidate will also contribute to the construction of test environments utilizing Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CICD) practices. This position provides an exciting opportunity to work in an Agile/Scrum development process, collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver quality software solutions. Notably, this role does not involve managing a team but requires strong self-management skills and a proactive work approach.
Responsibilities
Develop, document, and implement test plans and test cases that encompass all aspects of software functionality.
Execute manual and automated tests to identify software defects and verify compliance with acceptance criteria.
Conduct performance testing to ensure system stability, scalability, and responsiveness under varying loads.
Test backend services, including APIs and distributed services, to evaluate their functionality and integration.
Create and maintain clear and concise documentation of test results, defects, and issues encountered during testing.
Collaborate with developers and product managers to understand requirements and provide constructive feedback.
Utilize automation tools such as Selenium to enhance testing efficiency and coverage.
Participate in Agile/Scrum ceremonies, providing insights on testing progress and challenges to drive product quality.
Support the construction and maintenance of test environments, simplifying the testing process through CICD.
Apply strong analytical and troubleshooting skills to identify, analyze, and resolve software issues.

Modisoft Private Limited is seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Software Quality Assurance Engineer with a minimum of 2 years of experience in software testing methodologies, both manual and automated. This role is critical in ensuring the delivery of high-quality software products by performing thorough testing of backend services such as APIs and distributed systems. The successful candidate will possess strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, along with proficiency in tools and programming languages relevant to testing. The ideal candidate will contribute to the development and implementation of clear and comprehensive test plans and test cases, thereby enhancing the overall quality and performance of our software solutions. As a QA Engineer, you will be an integral part of the Agile/Scrum development process, collaborating closely with developers and product managers to identify testing needs and continuous improvement areas. You will have the opportunity to utilize your skills in performance testing and load testing while ensuring that automated testing tools are effectively integrated into our CI/CD pipelines. This role requires a proactive work style, strong interpersonal skills, and a commitment to excellence in software quality assurance. Although this position does not involve managing a team, you will work independently and collaboratively to uphold our company standards in software development.
Responsibilities
Develop, document, and manage comprehensive test plans and test cases to ensure quality control in software applications.
Execute manual and automated testing, including regression, load, and performance testing, to verify software functionality and performance under various scenarios.
Perform testing on backend services, such as APIs and distributed systems, ensuring their reliability and efficiency.
Utilize programming skills, particularly in Python or Java, to create custom test scripts and automation solutions.
Collaborate with the development team during the Agile/Scrum process to ensure timely and effective issue resolution.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand project requirements and translate them into effective testing strategies.
Assist in developing test environments and maintaining CI/CD pipelines to facilitate continuous integration and deployment.
Identify, document, and track software defects, ensuring appropriate follow-up and resolution.
Conduct root cause analysis of identified issues and contribute to continuous improvement of testing processes and tools.
Develop and execute performance tests to identify and mitigate bottlenecks within the application.
Provide clear and concise reporting on test results and quality metrics to project stakeholders.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in software testing, and recommend improvements to existing processes.

Required Skills: ['Jira Configuration', 'Manual Testing', 'Selenium', 'Test Automation', 'JMeter', 'Performance Testing', 'Regression Testing', 'Automated Testing', 'Selenium WebDriver', 'Quality Assurance']
Job Description:
Musketeers Tech is seeking a detail-oriented Software Quality Assurance Engineer to enhance the quality of our innovative mobile applications. This position plays a critical role in our software development lifecycle by ensuring that our applications meet the highest standards of performance, functionality, and reliability. The ideal candidate has a solid foundation in both manual and automated testing processes, demonstrating proficiency in tools and methodologies necessary to validate product quality. As a key contributor, you will collaborate closely with development teams to identify defects, conduct regression testing, and ensure compliance with industry standards and store requirements for mobile applications.
The successful Software Quality Assurance Engineer focuses on test automation and is adept at using testing frameworks such as Selenium and Appium. You will design, implement, and execute automated test cases, while also utilizing test management tools to provide transparency into the testing process. Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines is essential to integrate testing into our development process efficiently. You will play a pivotal role in optimizing our testing strategies to ensure high-quality output prior to deployment, thereby enhancing user satisfaction and overall product excellence.
Responsibilities
 Design, implement, and execute comprehensive automated test cases for mobile applications to ensure robust functionality and performance.
Conduct manual testing as needed to supplement automated tests, ensuring a thorough examination of application features.
Utilize testing frameworks such as Selenium and Appium to streamline the automated testing processes, thereby improving productivity and accuracy.
Create and maintain clear documentations of test plans, test cases, and testing procedures to provide consistent insights into the testing process.
Monitor application compliance with submission and review guidelines set by the Apple App Store and Google Play Store, contributing to successful application launch.
Work closely with cross-functional development teams to identify defects early in the development cycle and provide actionable feedback.
Leverage testing management tools like TestRail or Zephyr to document test results and track testing progress in real-time.
Participate in regular performance testing using tools like JMeter, ensuring applications can handle expected and peak loads.
Collaborate with CI/CD teams to integrate automated testing into build processes, facilitating quick identification of issues and promoting agile development practices.
Engage in regression testing to ensure that updates and enhancements to mobile applications do not adversely affect existing functionality.

Job Description:
We are seeking a passionate and detail-oriented QA Automation Engineer to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have experience with automation tools and frameworks, a solid understanding of software testing principles, and a strong desire to contribute to high-quality software releases. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop, maintain, and execute automated test scripts for web and mobile applications.
Key Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and maintain automated test scripts for functional, regression, and performance testing.
Collaborate with developers, product managers, and manual QA teams to understand requirements and ensure test coverage.
Execute automated test cases and analyze test results to identify defects and ensure the software meets quality standards.
Continuously enhance the automation framework to improve efficiency and expand coverage.
Report defects and track issues through the defect management tool.
Assist in maintaining test environments and contribute to Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.
Ensure adherence to best practices and testing standards across the team.
Key Requirements:
The ideal candidate should have 6 months to 1 year of hands-on experience in QA Automation.
They should be familiar with automation tools and have worked with test automation frameworks.
A basic understanding of version control systems and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) processes is essential.
The candidate should have experience in executing different types of tests, including functional, regression, and performance testing.
Strong verbal and written communication skills are a must, as well as the ability to analyze requirements, identify test scenarios, and ensure comprehensive test coverage.
Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality results are also key.
